item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: head(cars) ## speed dist ## 1 4 2 ## 2 4 10 ## 3 7 4 ## 4 7 22 ## 5 8 16 ## 6 9 10 summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min.

item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: head(cars) ## speed dist ## 1 4 2 ## 2 4 10 ## 3 7 4 ## 4 7 22 ## 5 8 16 ## 6 9 10 summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi - My name is Kim and this is my notebook, online portfolio, and blog about statistics, data science, and school.

item.title: My first blog post
item.description: Hello there - thanks for visiting my website. I will be re-posting my notes from school and personal projects on here, along with talking about my career in statistics. I am currently a masters in statistics newly grad, an instructor at my community college, and a freelance statistician also taking some computer science classes and studying for certification exams in preparation for applying to PhD programs and for applying to jobs where I can apply my knowledge to industry.
